item.name: Aleta
entries: This magic weapon looks like the snout of a swordfish and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

Instead of making a melee weapon attack with this sword, you can make a ranged weapon attack against a creature within 60 feet of you. This attack launches a small swordfish from the tip of the blade toward the target.

item.name: Bottled Lightning
entries: In this bottle floats a blue glowing orb. Bolts of lightning lash out from the orb to the bottle whenever someone touches the bottle.

As an action, you can remove the stopper of the bottle unleashing the stored lightning in a 100 feet long and 5 feet wide line in the direction the bottle is facing or you can throw the bottle at a point you can see within 30 feet of you. The bottle shatters on impact unleashing the stored lightning in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes damage according to the type of lightning stored in the bottle on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The DC for the saving throw is determined by the type of the stored lightning.

item.name: Googles of Day
entries: While wearing these dark lenses, you ignore the sunlight sensitivity feature if you have it.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards, Blileth Hurdy Gurdy
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition charmed} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell fly}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell levitate}, and {@spell protection from evil and good}.
In addition, the Blileth hurdy gurdy can be used to cast {@spell crown of stars|XGE}, {@spell glibness}, and {@spell modify memory}.

item.name: Tolling Bell
entries: As an action, you can chime the bell. When you do so, you cast {@spell toll the dead|XGE} (1st level, {@dc 13}) on every other creature within 30 feet of you that can hear the bell.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The racoon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the goro moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The goro can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The goro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goro makes two attacks: one with its fist and one with its hoof.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hoof
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}; {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 (2d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 88 (16d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon uses its psionics ability to cast one spell.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 (2d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}; {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)

If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}; {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}; {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Claw

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales psychoactive gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

hp.special: equal three times your Wisdom modifier + three times your druid level

trait.name: Might of the Master
entries: The bonuses to hit and damage of its slam attack increase by 1 when your proficiency bonus increases by 1.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The witherling is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Withering Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

hp.special: equal six times your Wisdom modifier + six times your druid level

trait.name: Might of the Master
entries: The bonuses to hit and damage of its slam attack increase by 1 when your proficiency bonus increases by 1.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The witherling is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Withering Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Aberation Oil
entries: Toxicity: 0
Duration: 8 hits
When you hit an abberation with the coated weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Antidote
entries: Toxicity: 3
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, any poison effect on you ends immediatly and you gain resistance against poison damage. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

optionalfeature.name: Brute
entries: Toxicity: 8
Duration: 30 seconds
For the potions duration, you gain advantage on all melee weapon attacks that use strength. In addition, all attacks against you have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Bull's Eye
entries: Toxicity: 4
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Oil
entries: Toxicity: 0
Duration: 8 hits
When you hit a celestial with the coated weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Cold
entries: Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to fire damage. In addition, you don't suffer the effects of extrem heat.

optionalfeature.name: Day
entries: Toxicity: 2
Duration: 2 hours
For the potions duration, you gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Durable
entries: Toxicity: 4
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Oil
entries: Toxicity: 0
Duration: 8 hits
When you hit an elemental with the coated weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Oil
entries: Toxicity: 0
Duration: 8 hits
When you hit an elemental with the coated weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fiend Oil
entries: Toxicity: 0
Duration: 8 hits
When you hit a fiend with the coated weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ground
entries: Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Leach
entries: Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Poisonous Oil
entries: Toxicity: 0
Duration: 16 hits
When you hit a creature with the coated weapon, the target must suceed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.
A poisoned creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Potency
entries: Toxicity: 8
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, you can cast {@spell burning hands}, {@spell charm person}, {@spell shield of faith} and {@spell thunderclap} at will.

optionalfeature.name: Regena
entries: Toxicity: 8
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, at the start of your turn, when you have at least 1 hit point left, but no more than half your hit point maximum, you regain hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Resilience
entries: Toxicity: 8
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain a +4 to your Constitution score and Constitution score maximum to a maximum of 30.

entries.name: Higher Potency
entries: You gain an additional +1 for each additional 2 points of toxicity you take.

optionalfeature.name: Retaliate
entries: Toxicity: 2
Duration: 1 minute
For the potions duration, when a creature damages you, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} psychic damage.

entries.name: Higher Potency
entries: The psychic damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each additional 2 points of toxicity you take.

optionalfeature.name: Sight
entries: Toxicity: 4
Duration: 2 hours
For the potions duration, you gain the effects of the {@spell see invisibly} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Slowing Oil
entries: Toxicity: 0
Duration: 16 hits
When you hit a creature with the coated weapon, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Steadfast

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 hour
Toxicity: 4
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you can't be {@condiiton stunned} or knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Stone

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 hour
Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Thick Hide
entries: Toxicity: 2
Duration: Instantaneous
You gain {@dice 1d4+4} temporary hit points.

entries.name: Higher Potency
entries: You gain additional 5 temporary hit points for each additional 2 points of toxicity you take.

optionalfeature.name: Thining Oil

entries.name: Duration
entries: 16 hits
Toxicity: 0
Duration: 16 hits

When you hit a creature with the coated weapon, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of the weapons type. A creature that does not bleed automatically succeeds on its saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Undead Oil

entries.name: Duration
entries: 8 hits
Toxicity: 0
Duration: 8 hits
When you hit an undead with the coated weapon, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Vampire Bane

entries.name: Duration
entries: 10 minutes
Toxicity: 3
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, when a creature hits you with a bite or similar attack or drinks your blood, the creature takes {@damage 2d10} poison damage.

entries.name: Higher Potency
entries: You can take additional toxicity in order to increase the potions damage by {@dice 1d10} for each additional 2 points of toxicity you take.

optionalfeature.name: Warmth

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 hour
Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to cold damage. In addition, you don't suffer the effects of extrem cold.

optionalfeature.name: Whirlwind

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 minute
Toxicity: 8
Duration: 1 minute
For the potions duration, you can take the {@action dodge} action as a bonus action on your turn. In addition, you gain a +2 to your AC and your speed increases by 10 feet.

spell.name: Catch Lightning

time.condition: which you take when you see a lightning within 60 feet of you

m.text: a bottle or a similar container, which the spell consumes

entries: You attempt to catch a lightning inside a bottle. If the lightning is caused by a spell of 3rd level or lower or a natural lightning, it is cought in the bottle. If the lightning is caused by a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the lightning is cought in the bottle. A cought lightning takes the most direct way possible to you still affecting creatures in the way. If you catch a lightning it creates a bottled lightning. Your DM may allow you to catch other lightning effects such as the lightning breath of a blue dragon, comparing the effect to a spell of an appropriate level or setting an individual DC appropriate for the effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can catch lightning created by a spell of an equal or lower level of the spell slot you used without making an ability check.

spell.name: Positive Energy Flood

components.m: chalk and a circle of white silk

entries: You send ribbons of positive energy at one creature you can see within range. Unless the target is undead or a construct, it regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 5d8}.
If you target an undead with this spell, it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: College of Dancing
entries: TODO

subclassFeature.name: Gracious Combat
entries: When you join the College of Dancing at 3rd level, you learn how to use certain weapons in a more graceful and swift way and your nimble movements allow you to doge attacks.

For you, quaterstaffs, sickles and spears gain the finesse property. Futhermore, while you are not wearing any armor or using a shield, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Dance
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your dance can inspire others.

When a creature other than youself within 60 feet of you that you can see makes a saving throw or an attack roll, you can use your reaction to expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration, rolling a Bardic Inspiration die and adding the number rolled to the creature's roll. You can choose to use this feature after the creature makes its roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll or saving throw succeeds or fails. To gain this benefit, a creature must be able to see you.

subclassFeature.name: Rousing Dance
entries: At 6th level, you can use your action to start dancing. If you do so, choose one creature within 60 feet of you that you can see, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save the creature starts dancing wasting its next turn in the process. On your subsequent turns, you can use your bonus action to sustain the dance. A dancing creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn to end the effect early. The creature is immune if it can't see you or it is immune to being charmed.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master's Dance
entries: Starting at 14th level, whenever you use your Inspiring Dance feature, you can roll a d6 and use it instead of expending a Bardic Inspiration die.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Blight
entries: TODO

subclassFeature.name: Withering Shape
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you can use your wild shape in more unnatural ways.

As an action, you can expand one use of your wild shape feature to summon a {@creature witherling|CeldirasCompendiumOfKnowledge}. Choose a point within 60 feet of you where the {@creature witherling|CeldirasCompendiumOfKnowledge} appears, each creature in a 10-foot radius of that point must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or take necrotic damage equal to half your druid level. The {@creature witherling|CeldirasCompendiumOfKnowledge} stays for a duration of 1 minute, you dismiss it as a bonus action, its hit points are reduce to zero, or you use this feature again. In combat, the {@creature witherling|CeldirasCompendiumOfKnowledge} shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take one of the actions in its stat block or the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Help}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Search} action.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Decay
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can steal the life force from creatures around you.

As an action, you can force each creature within 10 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} and you regain hit points equal to half the inflicted damage. Your {@creature witherling|CeldirasCompendiumOfKnowledge} gains this feature as well. Once you or your {@creature witherling|CeldirasCompendiumOfKnowledge} use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hulking Wither
entries: Beginning at 10th level, whenever you use your withering shape feature, you can expend two uses of your wild shape feature to summon a {@creature witherhulk|CeldirasCompendiumOfKnowledge} instead of a {@creature witherling|CeldirasCompendiumOfKnowledge}

subclassFeature.name: Master of Decay
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you have mastered your withering nature.
You are immune to poison and disease and you gain resistance to necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Strider
entries: Basically a Witcher

subclassFeature.name: Meditation
entries: At 3rd level, instead of sleeping for 8 hours, you can enter a deep meditational trance for 4 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Strider Lore
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies.
Futhermore, you learn to cast the {@spell friends}, {@spell gust}, {@spell mold earth}, {@spell produce flame} and {@spell resistance} cantrips. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemy
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to create {@filter strider potions|optionalfeatures|feature type=SPF}. These potions are posionous to everyone that is not a strider.

entries.name: Preparing Formulae and using Mixtures
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, you prepare a number of formulae equal to your Wisdom modifier + your fighter level divided by three. The formulae must be for potions. Preparing the formulae reflects four hours of brewing as part of your long rest, creating the mixtures you will use until your next long rest. As a bonus action on your turn, you can ingest a potion gaining its benefits, but increasing your toxicity level. If you use the same potion twice their effects don't stack.

entries.name: Toxicity Level and Toxixity Limit
entries: When you ingest a potion, your toxicity level increases by an amount noted in the formula. Your toxicity limit determines how high your toxicity level can get without suffering any drawbacks. When your toxicity level exceeds your toxicity limit, you take an amount of d10s of poison damage equal to the formulas toxicity cost ignoring resistances and immunities and your hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the poison damage you took. After you reduced your toxicity level below your toxicity limit, you can restore your hit point maximum using a greater restoration spell or similar magic. Additionally, you become poisoned until your toxicity level no longer exceeds your toxicity limit.When you finish a long rest, your toxicity level is reduced back to zero.

subclassFeature.name: Oils
entries: At 7th level, you learned to create {@filter oils|optionalfeatures|feature type=SOF} in addition to potions using your alchemy feature. You can now prepare {@filter oils|optionalfeatures|feature type=SOF}.

As an action, you can apply an oil to your weapon granting it the {@filter oils|optionalfeatures|feature type=SOF} benefits. The effect lasts for its duration or until you spend one minute removing the oil from the weapon. If you apply a second oil to the weapon before finishing a short rest, the {@filter oils|optionalfeatures|feature type=SOF} neutralize eachother.

subclassFeature.name: Special Ingredient
entries: At 10th level, you can add one of three special ingedients to your potions.

When you ingest a potion, you can choose one of the following effects to gain in addition to the potions normal effect. After you chose one ingredient, you can't choose that ingredient again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Giant's Toe
entries: You added a bit of a giant's toe to your potion giving you a +3 to all strength based damage rolls you make within the next minute.

entries.name: Troll Blood
entries: You added a bit of a troll's blood. At the start of your turn, when you are not incapacitated and have not taken acid or fire damage this round, you regain an amount of hit points equal to your fighter level divided by three (rounded down) for the next minute.

entries.name: Celestial Liver
entries: You added a bit of a celestial's liver reducing your toxicity level by an amount equal to your fighter level divided by three (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Skilled Eye
entries: At 15th level, your knowledge about monsters grants you insight into a monsters defenses.

On your turn, you can target one creature and make a Wisdom (Insight) check against a DC equal to 10 + the target's challenge rating divided by two, in order to gain insight into either the targets hit points, weaknesses or resistances and immunities. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Angel's Tear
entries: At 18th level, you learned how to create a special potion.
As an action, you can ingest that potion reducing your toxicity level to zero and ending all potion effects on you. After you used this feature, you can't use it again unit you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Bonfire
entries: TODO

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Flaming Weapon
entries: As an action, you can imbue one weapon that you are holding with fire, using your Channel Divinity.

For 1 minute, the weapon deals extra fire damge equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1). The weapon also ignites and emits bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light 20 feet beyond that. You can end this effect on your turn as part of any other action.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Blind the Wicked
entries: As an action, you present your holy symbol emmiting bright blinding light, using your Channel Divinity

Each hostile creature that can see you within 30 feet of you must make a Constituition saving throw. Creatures with darkvision make this saving throw with disadvantage. If a creature fails the saving throw, it is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect early on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Bonfire Spells
rows: {@spell summon elemental|TCE|summon elemental (fire only)}, {@spell fire shield}

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Bonfire
entries: TODO

entries.name: Protect the Flame
entries: All fire is sacred and must be protected.

entries.name: Extinguish the Night
entries: Their is nothing more wicked than Darkness and the creatures that come with it.

entries.name: Warm the Cold
entries: Your inner fire should warm those who lost their own.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Warmth
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your inner fire starts to effect the air around you. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to cold damage.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Lord of Flames
entries: Beginning at 15th level, you gain fire resistance and your Divine Smite can now deal fire or radiant damage (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Blazing Nimbus
entries: At 20th level, as an action, you can emanate an aura of heat.

For 1 minute the air around you starts to flicker with heat in a 30-foot radius. Whenever an enemy creature starts its turn in this area, the creature takes 10 fire damage. In addition, for the duration all ice and water within the radius vaporizes.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
